newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP plans to open Ireland service center.
newsitem.headline: SAP plans to open Ireland service center.

text.p: German business software developer SAP AG said on Wednesday it would expand its custom support capability by opening a telephone service center in Ireland.
The SAP Service and Support Centre Ltd. in Dublin would open in April and provide support for European customers and remote services for customers worldwide.

"Together with our customers we will profit not only from Ireland's excellent digital telecommunications infrastructure but also from the large number of well educated professionals in the labour market there."
SAP expected the center to begin operations with 30 employees and to add about 100 or more by the end of 1998.
